title: Robert Leonard Groome
text:
<a href="Admiral%20%28Royal%20Navy%29">Admiral</a> Robert Leonard Groome <a href="Commander%20of%20the%20Royal%20Victorian%20Order">CVO</a> (10 September 1848 – 22 November 1917) was a <a href="Royal%20Navy">Royal Navy</a> officer who became Commander-in-Chief of the <a href="South%20East%20Coast%20of%20America%20Station">South East Coast of America Station</a>.
Naval career.
Promoted to <a href="Captain%20%28Royal%20Navy%29">captain</a> on 4 August 1890, Groome became commanding officer of the <a href="cruiser">cruiser</a> <a href="Apollo-class%20cruiser">HMS "Tribune"</a> in July 1893, of the <a href="protected%20cruiser">protected cruiser</a> <a href="HMS%20Aeolus%20%281891%29">HMS "Aeolus"</a> in January 1894 and of the protected cruiser <a href="HMS%20Terrible%20%281895%29">HMS "Terrible"</a> in June 1897. He went on to be commanding officer of the <a href="battleship">battleship</a> <a href="HMS%20Repulse%20%281892%29">HMS "Repulse"</a> in December 1897, of the cruiser <a href="HMS%20Flora%20%281893%29">HMS "Flora"</a> in June 1899 and of the protected cruiser <a href="HMS%20Cambrian%20%281893%29">HMS "Cambrian"</a> in May 1901. After that he became Commander-in-Chief of the <a href="South%20East%20Coast%20of%20America%20Station">South East Coast of America Station</a> in June 1899, Rear-Admiral, Portsmouth Division in January 1905 and Rear-Admiral, <a href="Channel%20Fleet">Channel Fleet</a> in November 1905. He served as <a href="Department%20of%20the%20Director%20of%20Transports">Director of Transports</a> at the <a href="British%20Admiralty">Admiralty</a> from November 1907 to December 1911 holding the rank of <a href="vice-admiral">vice-admiral</a>.
